v8:item.v8:content: Shows whether the additional attribute is required or not.
The attribute inherits the master attribute's list of values.
Shows whether the attribute can be included in multiple attribute sets.

Settings.QueryText: SELECT SetsOverridable.Ref AS Ref, SetsOverridable.DataVersion AS DataVersion, SetsOverridable.DeletionMark AS DeletionMark, SetsOverridable.Predefined AS Predefined, SetsOverridable.Parent AS Parent, SetsOverridable.IsFolder AS IsFolder, SetsOverridable.Description AS Description, SetsOverridable.Used AS Used, CAST("" AS STRING(150)) AS Presentation, &PropertyKind AS PropertyKind, CASE WHEN SetsOverridable.DeletionMark THEN 1 ELSE 0 END + CASE WHEN SetsOverridable.Predefined THEN 2 ELSE 0 END AS PictureNumber, SetsOverridable.AttributesCount AS AttributesCount, SetsOverridable.InfoCount AS InfoCount, SetsOverridable.LabelCount AS LabelCount FROM Catalog.AdditionalAttributesAndInfoSets AS SetsOverridable WHERE CASE WHEN SetsOverridable.Parent = VALUE(Catalog.AdditionalAttributesAndInfoSets.EmptyRef) THEN SetsOverridable.Ref IN (&Sets) ELSE SetsOverridable.Parent IN (&Sets) END AND SetsOverridable.Used AND ISNULL(SetsOverridable.Parent.Used, TRUE) AND NOT SetsOverridable.DeletionMark

v8:item.v8:content: Move the attribute up the list.
Move the attribute down the list.
Create an attribute by copying the selected attribute.
Open the selected attribute for edit.
Add an item that belongs to another set.
Copy the selected additional attribute to the clipboard.
Insert the attribute from the clipboard to the current set.
